p: Hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome (HFRS), a rodent-borne viral disease caused by different species of hantaviruses, is characterized with fever, hemorrhage, headache, back pain, abdominal pain, and acute kidney injury [1]. HFRS, initially described clinically at the turn of the 20th century,is primarily distributed in the Asian and European continents [2]. In western and central Europe one of the most important hantavirus is Puumala virus [3], [4], while in China there are two predominant species of hantavirus, Hantaan and Seoul virus, each of which has co-evolved with a distinct rodent host [5].
